Package ohos.agp.components

Class VelocityDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.VelocityDetector

  • public final class VelocityDetector
extends Object
    Helper for detecting the velocity of touch events, for implementing flinging and other similar gestures.
    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      protected static class  VelocityDetector.VelocityDetectorCleaner
      The callback for releasing native Style object.

      Obtains the X velocity calculated most recently.

    • Method Detail

      • obtainInstance

        public static VelocityDetector obtainInstance​()
        Obtains a new VelocityDetector instance to detect the velocity of a motion.
        Returns:
        Returns the VelocityDetector instance.
        Since:
        4

      • clear

        public void clear​()
        Resets a VelocityDetector instance to the initial state.

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent​(TouchEvent event)
        Adds a user's movement to the Detector.

        You can call this method to detect any movement.

        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the event that you want to detect, which is a TouchEvent instance.
        Since:
        4

      • calculateCurrentVelocity

        public void calculateCurrentVelocity​(int units)
        Calculates the current velocity based on points that have been collected.

        After the calculation is completed, you can use getHorizontalVelocity() and getVerticalVelocity() to retrieve the velocity result.

        Parameters:
        units - Indicates the unit for the velocity result. The value 1 indicates pixels per millisecond, 1000 indicates pixels per second, and so on.

      • calculateCurrentVelocity

        public void calculateCurrentVelocity​(int units,
                                     float maxVxVelocity,
                                     float maxVyVelocity)
        Calculates the current velocity based on points that have been collected and specifies upper limits for calculated X and Y velocities.

        After the calculation is completed, you can use getHorizontalVelocity() and getVerticalVelocity() to retrieve the velocity result.

        Parameters:
        units - Indicates the for the velocity result. The value 1 indicates pixels per millisecond, 1000 indicates pixels per second, and so on.
        maxVxVelocity - Indicates the maximum X velocity.
        maxVyVelocity - Indicates the maximum Y velocity.

      • getHorizontalVelocity

        public float getHorizontalVelocity​()
        Obtains the X velocity calculated most recently.

        You must first call calculateCurrentVelocity(int) before calling this function.

        Returns:
        Returns the most recently calculated X velocity.
        Since:
        4

      • getVerticalVelocity

        public float getVerticalVelocity​()
        Obtains the Y velocity calculated most recently.

        You must call calculateCurrentVelocity(int) before calling this function.

        Returns:
        Returns the most recently calculated Y velocity.
        Since:
        4

      • getVelocity

        public float[] getVelocity​()
        Obtains the velocity calculated most recently.

        Before calling this method, you must call calculateCurrentVelocity(int).

        Returns:
        Returns the most recently calculated velocity.
        Since:
        4
